Well, it's Portal. the puzzles are easy, the game is short, but still get it

The first opus of Portal, and the one that made me discover the games developed by Valve: an undisputed success. Even if you started by buying Portal 2, and if the gameplay of the first Portal might seem more simplistic to you, since the game elements are less developed there, the increasingly difficult "tests" and the dubious humor of GlaDOS (not to mention the simple pleasure of playing the beginning of this story, of which you know the future twists) are worth already the investment, and get all the achievements without taking advantage of glitches and a real challenge, which will make you think for many hours. Looking for a game with realistic 3D graphics that gets you thinking without feeling like playing a puzzle? You don't need to search any longer, the "Portal" series is exactly what you need.
Positive points: the rich story, the 3D gameplay far from what is usual in puzzle games, the tests in "challenge" mode.
Negative points: the first "tests" really too simple (a single tutorial test would have been enough to learn the principles of the game), the escape behind the scenes of Aperture too short (it's the most funny part of the game...).

One of my favourite games ever. I say "one of" because of the sequel.

This games freaking awesome, one of the best I've ever played! Really great concept with an even better execution in the gameplay, mechanics, graphics and more. It seemed like just a fun puzzle game until suddenly it changed to suspenseful, back to puzzles, back to suspense, and then to just absolutely hilarious. It's a must play and I would highly recommend that everyone who has had a crush on Hitler suck an egg.

Port hole

I think this game is still amazing to this day and I would recommend it to a lot of other people. The main game itself is already amazing with the story and just the physics of the portals themselves to mess around with. But The developers even went an extra step and added harder versions of all of the levels and ones with commentary about them, which is super cool. The only negative was a few lag spikes, but I think that's just because I'm playing on a MacBook Pro. But yeah, I would definetly recommend trying this game out for how well it's aged!
